headline: These Stocks Moved the Most Today: Warner Bros., Oracle, Micron, Opendoor, Synopsys, Centene, Delta, and More
summary: Stocks soared Thursday as investors shrugged off data showing the consumer price index rose for the fourth month in a row in August, reasoning the Federal Reserve is still likely to cut interest rates at next week’s meeting of its policy committee.  Warner Bros. Discovery  surged 29% after The Wall Street Journal reported that  Paramount Skydance  was prepping a takeover bid.  Oracle  was down 6.2%, a day after shares of the database-software company gained 36% to hit a record high of $328.33.

headline: Synopsys Stock Rises. Why This Analyst Sees a Buying Opportunity After Wednesday’s Pummeling.
summary: Shares of  Synopsys  suffered their worst same-day percent decrease on record Wednesday.  Mizuho  analysts described the double-digit percent decline in the stock relative to a flat  as “an overreaction and a buying opportunity,” after the electronic design automation company’s fiscal third-quarter earnings revealed weakness in its intellectual property business.  Shares ended the session down 36% on Wednesday, marking the largest same-day percentage decrease since  Synopsys  began trading in February 1992.

headline: Opendoor, Alibaba, Synopsys: Trending Stocks
summary: Viral meme stock Opendoor (OPEN) gets another huge boost in pre-market after it announced Shopify (SHOP) COO will join the company as CEO, Alibaba (BABA) sneaks up as it announces a new tech funding deal worth around $3.2 billion, and Synopsys (SNPS) regains some of its lost share value.

headline: Synopsys (SNPS) Drops to 5-Month Low on Dismal Earnings
summary: We recently published 10 Stocks Melt Down in Hours. Synopsys Inc. (NASDAQ:SNPS) is one of the worst performers on Wednesday. Shares of Synopsys fell by 35.84 percent on Wednesday to a new five-month low, as investor sentiment was dampened by a dismal earnings performance in the third quarter of fiscal year 2025.
